sentences.sContent: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.sCn: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.sContent: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.sCn: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.sContent: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.sCn: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

sentences.sContent: ...According to a series of experiments published in the Quarterly Journal of Experimental Psychology by professors Gary Lupyan and Daniel Swignley...
...we face a series of deadlines that require us to make major decisions about how to pay down our deficit —decisions that will have a huge impact on the economy and the middle class...
...the CDC—the Center for Disease Control and Prevention came up with a series of advertisements from former smokers called TIPS...
...which is why I was happy to see Nature devote a special series of articles to the GM food controversy...
...a series in The New York Times...
...with a series of short chapters dedicated to specific aspects of urbanity-parks...
...What sealed Nokia's fate was a series of decisions made by Stephen Elop in his position as CEO...
...Chinese Academy of Sciences released a series of annual reports about its latest scientific findings and a blueprint for the coming year...
...the US government enforced a series of policies designed to reduce reliance on foreign oil...
...with a series of short chapters dedicated to specific aspects of urbanity - parks...

synos.tran: 系列，连续；[电]串联；[数]级数；丛书

phrases.pCn: 时间序列分析；时序分析
[物]串联电抗器；[物]平滑扼流圈
串联变压器；串联变换器；级联变压器
串联电阻器；附加电阻器

trans.tranCn: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
trans.tranOther: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other
